result.markdown:
--- title: "Difference Scores: Paired Samples T-test" author: "Biostatistics Working Group" --- # Paired Samples T-test {.unnumbered} ## Overview

This example examines the question whether participants reported different mean levels of externalizing problems on the CBCL when measured at Baseline (T0) compared to when measured at the 1-Year follow-up (T1). This analysis is conducted in two primary steps: 1) computing a difference score (DiffScore = CBCL EXT T2 - CBCL EXT T1); 2) conducting a paired samples t-test on the difference score. Our primary aim is to determine whether average CBCL externalizing scores of the participants change from assessement 1 (T1) to assessement 2 (T2), while accounting for observations that are clustered within youth over time.

## Preliminary Setup ::: panel-tabset ### Install Packages {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills} ::: blue > **This code installs the r packages necessary for this example, if > they are not already installed** ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/pckg-install_f4cb9c96dd05c13d483448897eeeef07'} ```{.r .cell-code} #rm(list = ls()) if (!("lme4" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("lme4") if (!("lmerTest" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("lmerTest") if (!("tidyverse" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("tidyverse") if (!("arrow" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("arrow") if (!("arsenal" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("arsenal") if (!("kableExtra" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("kableExtra") if (!("ggpubr" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("ggpubr") if (!("rstatix" %in% installed.packages())) install.packages("rstatix") ``` ::: ::: ### Load Packages ::: blue **This code loads the r libraries necessary for this example** ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/lib-load_96420a57e9caaec7ea29b59c7bcf4b93'} ```{.r .fold-hide .cell-code} #rm(list = ls()) library(lme4) library(lmerTest) library(tidyverse) library(arrow) library(arsenal) library(kableExtra) library(rstatix) library(ggpubr) ``` ::: ::: ### Config Options ::: blue **This code configures knitr code chunk options** ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/config_f2c14a26181f37163e2c3378de3a2fcd'} ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = T, message=F, warning=F, error=F, comment=NA, cache=T, code_folding=T, R.options=list(width=220), fig.align='center', out.width='75%', fig.asp=.75) ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Descriptives Overview ::: panel-tabset ### Read and View Data {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills} ::: blue **This code reads in and shows the data to be used in the current example** ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/read-data_d36a1f930706cd550db7bf0ed915ea0c'} ```{.r .cell-code} ## Read data df_long<- read_csv("/Users/shawes/Desktop/data/df_long.csv") df_wide <- read_csv("/Users/shawes/Desktop/data/df_wide.csv") # set types df_long$ids <- as.factor(df_long$ids) df_long$event <- as.factor(df_long$event) df_long$site_id <- as.factor(df_long$site_id) df_long$fam_id <- as.factor(df_long$fam_id) df_long$sex <- as.factor(df_long$sex) df_long$age <- as.numeric(df_long$age) df_long$mature_vg <- as.numeric(df_long$mature_vg) df_long$cbcl_extern <- as.numeric(df_long$cbcl_extern) df_long$vg_total <- as.numeric(df_long$vg_total) ``` ::: ::: ### Continuous Outcomes ::: blue **This code creates a table of descriptive information for continuous outcomes** ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/contvar-table_ef5d6f8f5a2de08b5be6c71e5d4f3095'} ```{.r .cell-code} ## Create a descriptives table of study variables by measurement occasion tab_descriptives_1 <- tableby.control(test=FALSE, total=FALSE, numeric.test="kwt", cat.test="chisq", numeric.stats=c("N", "meansd", "median", "range"), #"Nmiss2" cat.stats=c("countpct"), #"Nmiss2" stats.labels=list(N='Count', meansd="Mean (SD)", median ='Median', range='Min - Max')) #, Nmiss2 ='Missing' my_cont_labels <- list(age = "Age", vg_total = "Weekly # of Video Gaming Hrs", cbcl_extern = "CBCL Externalizing Scale" ) tab_descriptives_1 <- tableby(event ~ age + vg_total + cbcl_extern, data=df_long, control=tab_descriptives_1) # Push table object through kable and kable_styling tab_descriptives_1 %>% summary(text=TRUE, digits.pct=1, digits=1) %>% kable(caption = "Continuous Outcomes") %>% kable_styling(bootstrap_options = "striped", full_width = FALSE, html_font = "Cambria", font_size = 15, position = "center", fixed_thead = T) %>% row_spec(2:3, bold = F, extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;') %>% column_spec(1, width = "20em", background = "light grey", bold = T, border_right = T) %>% column_spec(2, width = "20em", border_right = T) %>% column_spec(3, width = "20em", border_right = T) %>% footnote(general = "Here is a general comments of the table. ") %>% scroll_box(width = "75%", height = "500px") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Continuous Outcomes
Baseline (N=35) Year_1 (N=34) Year_2 (N=30)

- Count 35 34 30
- Mean (SD) 9.3 (0.5) 9.5 (0.5) 9.6 (0.5)
- Median 9.0 9.5 10.0
- Min - Max 9.0 - 10.0 9.0 - 10.0 9.0 - 10.0
vg_total
- Count 35 34 30
- Mean (SD) 8.7 (8.4) 8.7 (8.1) 6.8 (4.3)
- Median 6.0 7.0 7.0
- Min - Max 0.0 - 28.0 0.0 - 28.0 1.0 - 16.0
cbcl_extern
- Count 35 34 30
- Mean (SD) 4.8 (5.7) 5.5 (6.1) 6.9 (6.9)
- Median 3.0 4.0 4.5
- Min - Max 0.0 - 21.0 0.0 - 25.0 0.0 - 25.0
Note:
Here is a general comments of the table.
````` ::: ::: ::: ### Categorical Outcomes ::: blue **This code creates a descriptives table for categorical outcomes** ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/catvar-table_99e31945fdffff6befce69968bf57b81'} ```{.r .fold-hide .cell-code} ## Create a descriptives table of study variables by measurement occasion tab_descriptives_2 <- tableby.control(test=FALSE, total=FALSE, numeric.test="kwt", cat.test="chisq", numeric.stats=c("N", "meansd", "median", "range" ), # "Nmiss2" cat.stats=c("countpct"), # "Nmiss2" stats.labels=list(N='Count', meansd="Mean (SD)", median ='Median', range='Min - Max' )) # , Nmiss2 ='Missing' my_cat_labels <- list( event = "Year", sex = "Sex", mature_vg = "Mature Video Games" ) tab_descriptives_2 <- tableby(event ~ sex + mature_vg, data=df_long, control=tab_descriptives_2) # Push table object through kable and kable_styling tab_descriptives_2 %>% summary(text=TRUE, digits.pct=1, digits=1) %>% kable(caption = "Categorical Outcomes") %>% kable_styling(bootstrap_options = "striped", full_width = FALSE, font_size = 15, position = "center", fixed_thead = T) %>% row_spec(2:3, bold = F, extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;') %>% column_spec(1, width = "20em", background = "light grey", bold = T, border_right = T) %>% column_spec(2, width = "20em", border_right = T) %>% #column_spec(3, width = "20em", border_right = T) %>% footnote(general = "Here is a general comments of the table. ") %>% scroll_box(width = "75%", height = "500px") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Categorical Outcomes
Baseline (N=35) Year_1 (N=34) Year_2 (N=30)
sex
- Female 19 (54.3%) 20 (58.8%) 17 (56.7%)
- Male 16 (45.7%) 14 (41.2%) 13 (43.3%)
mature_vg
- Count 35 34 30
- Mean (SD) 0.6 (0.9) 1.7 (6.3) 0.6 (0.9)
- Median 0.0 0.0 0.0
- Min - Max 0.0 - 3.0 0.0 - 37.0 0.0 - 3.0
Note:
Here is a general comments of the table.
````` ::: ::: ::: ::: ## Results
::: panel-tabset ### Build Model {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills} The code snippet below tells R to compute a difference score by subtracting each participant's Externalizing score at T2 from their Externalizing score at T1. Next, a one-sample t-test is computed to examine whether the average difference score is different than zero (indicating change). **STEP 1: Compute Difference Score** ::: {.cell hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/build-model-1_2e38a34e82fbbe875c31a0c1b0b6834f'} ```{.r .fold-hide .cell-code} # Compute difference score based on CBCL Externalizing subscale scores at baseline (t1) and 1-Year Follow-up (t2) df_wide$diffscore <- df_wide$cbcl_extern_Year_1 - df_wide$cbcl_extern_Baseline ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/model-checking_cbcf86e93865dd2b93a716d51bd9a403'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Compute statistical summaries for the difference score variable summary(df_wide$diffscore) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Min. 1st Qu. Median Mean 3rd Qu. Max. -27.000 1.000 5.000 5.576 8.000 33.000 ``` ::: ::: This summary of the difference score variable indicates xxxxx. ::: {.cell hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_eb68c081507739c80e49f3d9742f5f1f'} ```{.r .cell-code} hist(df_long$vg_total) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ## Summary statistics summary<-df_long %>% group_by(event) %>% get_summary_stats(cbcl_extern, type = "mean_sd") data.frame(summary) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: This histogram indicates xxxxxx. The summary command shows xxxxxx. ::: {.cell hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/shapiro-wilks_1dd4be5bb1eb12175ccdae5bb057a439'} ```{.r .cell-code} ### Shapiro-Wilk test and normality (Q-Q) plot (visualization of correlation between a given sample and the normal distribution) shapiro.test(df_wide$cbcl_extern_Baseline[0:5000]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Shapiro-Wilk normality test data: df_wide$cbcl_extern_Baseline[0:5000] W = 0.67151, p-value = 1.452e-13 ``` ::: ::: This Shapiro-Wilkes test shows xxxxxx. ::: {.cell hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/qqplot_a51102f1571e666f223eda257f5bcc80'} ```{.r .cell-code} qqplot <- ggqqplot(df_wide$cbcl_extern_Baseline, ylab = "Externalizing Difference Score", xlab = FALSE, ggtheme = theme_minimal() ) suppressWarnings(print(qqplot)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_files/figure-html/qqplot-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: This qqplot shows xxxxxx. **STEP 2: Conduct t-test on Difference Score** ::: {.cell hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/build-model-2_1b592ed42f60ede8fa4918eafde4dfae'} ```{.r .fold-hide .cell-code} # One-sample t-test to determine whether the average difference score is significantly different than 0. result <- t.test(df_wide$cbcl_extern_Baseline, mu = 0, alternative = "two.sided") # Print the results result ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` One Sample t-test data: df_wide$cbcl_extern_Baseline t = 6.3752, df = 98, p-value = 6.01e-09 alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 0 95 percent confidence interval: 2.003549 3.814633 sample estimates: mean of x 2.909091 ``` ::: ::: ::: The output from our model provides: i. a t-statistic ii. degrees of freedom under iii. p-value (\< .05 then we reject the null hypothesis) iv. a mean estimate v. 95% confidence intervals In our example p = .002 which is less than .05 then we reject the null hypothesis and conclude that the mean difference score µ is different from zero. So we can conclude that there𝐷 is a difference between cbcl externalizing scores from t1 to t2. This output also provides the mean for cbcl externalizing scores (4.45),as well as the correpsonding confidence intervals ### Model Plots ::: blue ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/scatterplot_016b2bc23ba5ecdbd59f485fe048a59e'} ```{.r .cell-code code-summary="testing"} # Scatterplot to visualize relationship between t1 & t2 data used to create difference score scatterplot <- ggplot(df_wide, aes(x = cbcl_extern_Baseline, y = cbcl_extern_Year_1)) + geom_point(size = 3) + geom_smooth(method = lm, se = F) + xlab("CBCL Externalizing (x) Baseline") + ylab("CBCL Externalizing (x) 1-Year Follow-up") suppressWarnings(print(scatterplot)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_files/figure-html/scatterplot-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Examination of this scatterplot indicates xxxxx. ::: {.cell messages='false' hash='1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_cache/html/boxplot_4d31afc4ce7c51a8ffd5eec8c494bd75'} ```{.r .cell-code code-summary="testing"} ### boxplot diffscore_boxplot <- ggboxplot(df_wide$cbcl_extern_Baseline, ylab = "Externalizing Difference Score", xlab = FALSE, ggtheme = theme_minimal() ) suppressWarnings(print(diffscore_boxplot)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](1a_HowTos_DifferenceScores_PairedTtests_files/figure-html/boxplot-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Examination of this boxplot indicates xxxxx. ::: > This output shows xxxxxxxx. Briefly walk through each metric ::: ## Wrapping Up
::: panel-tabset ### Write-up {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills} ::: blue A paired samples t test was conducted to compare differences in participants cbcl externalzing scores measured across two timepoints. Findings indicated that there was a difference between cbcl externalzing scores obtained at T1 compared to cbcl externalzing scores obtained at T2, t(179) = 3.10, p = .002, Cohen's d = 0.23. Youth exhibited an increase of cbcl externalzing scores at t2 ( M = 5.67, SD = 1.24) compared to t1 ( M = 5.83, SD = 1.21). ::: :::
